page.title: 03PAST ACTIVITY IN ASHTON (1)
page.content:
The main economic activity in the village of Ashton until recent times was the mining of tin and agriculture. The tin mines were situated in the mineralised zone which surrounds the granite mass of Tregonning Hill. Apart from tin copper was also found and extracted.
In the late nineteenth century the tin mines fell into decline due to cheaper overseas supplies. The men and their families who worked these mines had to move away from the area in search of new jobs. Many of them moved abroad to Australia, North America, South America, South Africa and various Commonwealth countries.
